issue.title: Suspicious code in `@babel/parser`

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: A closed issue/PR that is archived due to age. Recommended to make a new issue

repository.name: babel
repository.description: ðŸ  Babel is a compiler for writing next generation JavaScript.

body:
Saw you did some more investigating in https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/17180. Leaving those details here:

> Sorry for not following the issue template.
> 
> Prettier user raised an issue [prettier/prettier#17249](https://github.com/prettier/prettier/discussions/17249), after investigation, I found this bug is caused by turbopack, but I can't really say that's their fault, it's an edge case.
> 
> Looking at https://unpkg.com/browse/@babel/parser@7.26.10/lib/index.js L3195 and L3205
> 
> We have this code
> 
>     if (next === 109) {
>       // ...
>       var isDecimal = true;
>     }
> 
>     // ...
> 
>     if (isDecimal) {
>       // ...
>     }
> and turbopack bundled it as
> 
>    if (next === 109) {
>      // ...
>      var isDecimal = true;
>    }
> 
>    // ...
> 
>    if ("TURBOPACK compile-time truthy", 1) {
>       // ...
>    }
> 
>    "TURBOPACK unreachable";
>    // ...
> Then `if (isDecimal)` branch becomes `true`.
> 
> I think we should define a local variable instead of using `var`?
> 
> Code in source
> 
> [babel/packages/babel-parser/src/tokenizer/index.ts](https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/33110bf6a6e47ee084a79050a20ea67d9317af20/packages/babel-parser/src/tokenizer/index.ts#L1290)
> 
> Line 1290 in [33110bf](/babel/babel/commit/33110bf6a6e47ee084a79050a20ea67d9317af20)
> 
>  var isDecimal = true; 
> cc [@liuxingbaoyu](https://github.com/liuxingbaoyu)
Looks like a bug in static analysis in Turbopack. Will ask the team to investigate!

issue.title: fix(turbopack): Consider scoping of `var` declarations

body: This closed issue has been automatically locked because it had no new activity for 2 weeks. If you are running into a similar issue, please create a new issue with the steps to reproduce. Thank you.
